channel.title: BUbreakingHeadlines
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingHeadlines, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: EU Leaders Paving Way to Greener Climate Goals
Trump targets China trade deal as he arrives in Tokyo on Asia tour
University of Tennessee changes debt policy to fast-track construction on campuses
FTSE 100 LIVE: London muted as Asian markets hit record highs amid easing US-China trade tensions
HSBC to take $1.1 billion hit after Luxembourg court ruling in Madoff case
Trump says China trade deal likely to be finalized during his Asia trip
item.description: President Trump told reporters as he flew into Japan that he expects to have a trade agreement with China finalized by the end of his tour of Asia.

item.title: Trump refuses to rule out 3rd term, says he got 'perfect' MRI at Walter Reed
item.description: Speaking with reporters on board Air Force One on Monday, President Donald Trump again refused to rule out a bid for a third presidential term.

item.title: 10/26: CBS Weekend News
item.description: Hurricane Melissa, now Category 4, begins assault on Jamaica; Touring the city by the Bay with the Vampiress of San Francisco

item.title: Hurricane Melissa live updates: Storm upgraded to Category 5 on approach to Jamaica
item.description: Hurricane Melissa strengthened into a Category 5 storm as it churned northwest through the Caribbean Sea toward Jamaica.

item.title: Here's what to expect from the Fed's Wednesday interest rate meeting
item.description: Concerns about a weakening labor market may outweigh worries about rising inflation, tipping the Fed toward another rate cut, economists say.

item.title: Hurricane Melissa is a mighty Category 5 storm in the Caribbean
item.description: Melissa strengthened into the most powerful category a hurricane could and could bring "catastrophic" flash flooding and landslides to Jamaica, Haiti ...

item.title: 1 dead, 6 injured in shooting at Lincoln University homecoming event
item.description: Officials say one student and one graduate are among the people injured in the shooting at Lincoln University in Pennsylvania.

item.title: Shooting at a historically Black universityâ€™s homecoming fest in Pennsylvania kills 1 and wounds 6
Trump administration posts notice that no federal food aid will go out Nov. 1
item.description: The U.S. Department of Agriculture has posted a notice on its website saying federal food aid will not go out Nov. 1 as the government shutdown drags ...

item.title: WATCH: Snow leopard cub treated to first pumpkin at Michigan zoo
item.description: A snow leopard cub named Juniper was treated to her first pumpkin during Halloween-themed enrichment at the John Ball Zoo in Michigan.

item.title: Flights to LAX halted due to air traffic controller shortage
item.description: Flights departing for Los Angeles are being held due to a staffing shortage.

item.title: Flights to Los Angeles International Airport halted due to air traffic controller shortage
WATCH: Man struggles to walk as powerful winds hit France
item.description: Strong winds in central France made it difficult for the man seen in this video to stay upright, much less make any forward progress.
